Author: lukechilds#2707
Cryptoon#3362
Content: @lukechilds electrum servers are fixed, so now I dont have that issue anymore

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: But before I could just keep repeating the issue where I restarted hyper and it kept loading on that electrum server for vrsc that wasnt working. If I wanted to close hyper it said 'could not connect to marketmaker'

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: ohhh, I see

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: so most likely this is actually an issue with Electrum

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: If @0x03 was resyncing then the actual coin daemon on his node would (I think?) be locked. So we probably did successfully connect to the electrum server, but there was an issue with Electrum <-> coin daemon communication on the actual server that was hanging.

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: I don't think Electrum servers should be resyncing regularly, so this likely isn't a huge problem. But if people running electrum servers bring down electrum while they're resyncing coin daemons that would likely solve the issue

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: // cc @0x03 @cipi üòÉ

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: oh, it is down during the resync of the chain (i.e. the outside/p2p port is not bound to by electrumx)

Author: cipi#4502
Content: the problem isn't there on CLI, when i enable electrums and they are unreachable, it simply takes longer, but mm is showing an error and continues with the other electrums

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: that's odd

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: it's possible that we have an outdated version of mm, but I don't that that's it, I'm not aware of any recent changes to the way electrum timeout is handled

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
i also observed two different situations
1. the method "electrum" returns with an error saying the server is unreachable, so does the console output
2. the method "electrum" says everything is fine, but console says node is dead
on CLI this does not seem to make any difference, but i can imagine GUIs are relying on the info that mm returns (not the output in console)
i don't know where the difference between this 2 fails is... could be the difference is that one tcp connection returns "Connection refused" immediately and the other case is where Firewalls do their part and the connection attempt doesn't return anything, it is simply stuck... that may also cause the large delays when starting mm... it makes a difference if a connection attempt is refused immediately or if mm waits for the OS timeout... could be a good idea to try to cover this in the code by playing with the timeout-options, but i fear i don't have the knowledge to be able to tell this for sure

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: The GUI works fine with either an error or success response

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: if we get a success response but it actually errors that could definitely cause issues

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: but it wouldn't just hang, it would move on to the next electrum server

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: thanks for your help @cipi

Author: cipi#4502
Content: yes, you are right, it shouldn't hang forever... but i didn't experienced this with CLI, only that it takes much longer if i have bad electrums in my config
